COVID-19.description: COVID-19 is a respiratory illness caused by the SARS-CoV-2 virus. It can range from mild to severe and affects different people in different ways.
COVID-19.causes: Infection with the SARS-CoV-2 virus, which spreads through respiratory droplets.
treatment: Seek medical attention if symptoms are severe

Common Cold.description: The common cold is a viral infection of the upper respiratory tract that primarily affects the nose and throat.
prevention: Avoid close contact with infected people

Flu.description: Influenza (flu) is a contagious respiratory illness that can cause mild to severe illness, and sometimes can lead to death in vulnerable populations.
Flu.causes: Influenza viruses that infect the nose, throat, and lungs

Migraine.description: A migraine is a headache that can cause severe throbbing pain or a pulsing sensation, usually on one side of the head, often accompanied by nausea, vomiting, and extreme sensitivity to light and sound.
Migraine.causes: Genetic and environmental factors, certain triggers like stress or hormonal changes
treatment: Rest in a quiet, dark room

Allergies.description: Allergies occur when your immune system reacts to a foreign substance that doesn't cause a reaction in most people.
Allergies.causes: Various allergens including pollen, dust mites, pet dander, or certain foods
